comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: This chap looks somewhat like US Admiral Robert E. Coontz...who was with the US fleet that visited Australia in July/August 1925...covered in 3 special issues of the Sydney Mail...here's the first news.google.com/newspapers?id=6YNVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=K5YDA... the Library of Congress has a good pic of Coontz www.loc.gov/pictures/resource/npcc.14628/ ...but I can't find any pics of US admirals in the 1920s wearing a uniform similar to this one...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Wow the resemblance is quite strong, and the dates look to be right too. I'd love to get a confirmation on that uniform, as I have a niggling thought that this might be another theatre-type. Thanks for the links we've put them all into our records - I have a feeling this one will be solved :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Yes, I haven't crossed HMS Pinafore off my list of possibles just yet (!)

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Haha - if only he didn't look so much like a real, contemporary admiral! Just to confuse historians 90 years down the track :)
